Art. 4.27. 
Rights of close relatives among themselves 
Close relatives succeed, either in their own right or by substitution, in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 2.
If the brothers and sisters all have the same father and mother, they succeed in equal portions.
If they do not have the same father and mother, a distinction is made between the paternal and maternal lines of the deceased. The share of the estate that goes to close relatives devolves equally to each of the two lines. First-degree relatives share in both lines; half-brothers and half-sisters with the same father share in the paternal line only; half-brothers and half-sisters with the same mother share in the maternal line only. If there are brothers and sisters on only one side, they succeed to the whole, to the exclusion of all other relatives in the other line.
